ch.zhaw.it15a_zh.psit3_03.mealmanager.adapters

Class InnerWeekplanAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
      • ch.zhaw.it15a_zh.psit3_03.mealmanager.adapters.InnerWeekplanAdapter

  • public class InnerWeekplanAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
    The InnerWeekplanAdapter handles the layout of an individual group of recipes, which are grouped by Date

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  InnerWeekplanAdapter.WeekplanFooterViewHolder
      Sets teh ViewHolder for the Footer, which allows the user to add recipes to a dayPlan.
      private class  InnerWeekplanAdapter.WeekplanHeaderViewHolder
      Sets the ViewHolder for HeaderItems.
      private class  InnerWeekplanAdapter.WeekplanItemViewHolder
      Sets the ViewHolder for RowItems.

                            Context context)
        Adapter which handles populating individual rows of a CardView with content
        Parameters:
        dateHeader - Date for which the recipes will be grouped by
        userPlannedRecipeList - List of recipes which have been planned for that specific day (dateHeader)
        context - Originating activity context

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder holder,
                             int position)
        Populates the header (Date), itemRows (planned recipes)(if they exsist) and footer(add recipes to a day) with the appropriate information from the mmdb database combined with the dates the user selected in the datepicker activity, if he picked any.

        Parameters:
        holder - Specifies which item to render. Header, itemRow or Footer.
        position - Which Row of the list will be rendered.

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        Shows how many rows the Adapter needs to render. The list adds two because it always needs to render the header and the footer.
        Specified by:
        getItemCount in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Returns:
        ListSize + 2;

      • getItemViewType

        public int getItemViewType(int position)
        Returns the ViewType (Header, ItemRow or Footer) for a given position in the list.
        Overrides:
        getItemViewType in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        position - Which item from the list it requires to get viewType clarification
        Returns:
        TYPE_HEADER = 0, TYPE_ITEM= 1, TYPE_FOOTER = 2;

      • isPositionHeader

        private boolean isPositionHeader(int position)
        Returns a Position for the getItemView Type
        Parameters:
        position - Which position the needs to be clarified
        Returns:
        True if position is 0 (Header), otherwise false.

      • isPositionFooter

        private boolean isPositionFooter(int position)
        Returns a Position for the getItemView Type
        Parameters:
        position - Which position the needs to be clarified
        Returns:
        True if position is listSize+1 (Footer), otherwise false.
